required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Nivolumab in Patients With Classical Hodgkin's Lymphoma (Registrational)
clinical_study.official_title: Non-Comparative, Multi-Cohort, Single Arm, Open-Label, Phase 2 Study of Nivolumab (BMS-936558) in Classical Hodgkin Lymphoma (cHL) Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Nivolumab in previously treated (cohorts, A, B & C) or newly diagnosed (cohort D) classical Hodgkin Lymphoma participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Objective Response Rate (ORR) Based on IRRC Assessments in Cohorts A, B, and C
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of first study drug dose up to approximately 28 months
primary_outcome.description: To assess the clinical benefit of nivolumab, as measured by ORR based on IRRC assessment, and defined as proportion of subjects achieving either a PR or CR according to the 2007 IWG criteria. Analyses of efficacy endpoints were performed separately for each cohort, according to IWG 2007. For cohort A and B, if the bone marrow was involved by lymphoma before treatment, the infiltrate must have cleared on repeat bone marrow biopsy. For cohort C, no evidence of FDG-avid disease in bone marrow will be required in all patients in lieu of bone marrow aspirate/ biopsy.

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of Objective Response in Cohorts A, B, and C
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of first study drug dose up to approximately 28 months
primary_outcome.description: DOR was defined as the time from first response (CR or PR) to the date of the first documented tumor progression as determined by the investigator using the 2007 IWG criteria or death due to any cause, whichever occurred first. Appearance of any new lesion > 1.5 cm in any axis during or at the end of therapy, even if other lesions are decreasing in size. Increased FDG uptake in a previously unaffected site should only be considered relapsed or PD after confirmation with other modalities.

primary_outcome.measure: Complete Remission Rate in Cohorts A, B, and C
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of first study drug dose up to approximately 28 months
primary_outcome.description: The CR rate was defined as the number of subjects with a BOR of CR according to the 2007 IWG criteria, based on IRRC assessment, divided by the number of treated subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of Complete Remission (CR) for Cohorts A, B, and C
primary_outcome.time_frame: from date of first documented CR up to approximately 28 months
primary_outcome.description: The CR rate was defined as the number of subjects with a BOR of CR according to the 2007 IWG criteria, based on IRRC assessment, divided by the number of treated subjects. The duration of CR was only evaluated in subjects with BOR of CR and was defined as the time from first documentation of CR (the date of first negative FDG-PET scan or the date of first documentation of no disease involvement in the bone marrow (if required), whichever occurred later) to the date of initial objectively documented progression as determined using the 2007 IWG criteria or death due to any cause, whichever occurred first. Censoring was applied as per DOR definition.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Experienced at Least One Treatment Related Grade 3-5 AE in Cohort D
primary_outcome.time_frame: From last dose up to 120 days
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of nivolumab monotherapy during the monotherapy phase and the safety and tolerability of nivolumab in combination with AVD during the combination phase

secondary_outcome.measure: Partial Remission (PR) Rate in Cohorts A, B, and C
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of the first documented PR up to approximately 28 months
secondary_outcome.description: The PR rate was defined as the number of subjects with a BOR of PR according to the 2007 IWG criteria, based on IRRC assessment, divided by the number of treated subjects.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of PR in Cohorts A, B, and C
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of the first documented PR up to approximately 28 months
secondary_outcome.description: The duration of PR was only evaluated in subjects with BOR of PR and was defined as the time from first documentation of PR to the date of initial objectively documented progression as determined using the 2007 IWG criteria or death due to any cause, whichever occurred first. Censoring was applied as per DOR definition.

secondary_outcome.measure: ORR Based on Investigator Assessments for Cohorts A, B, and C
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the first dose to first progression, death, or start of other therapy up to 28 months
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator-assessed ORR and DOR were defined similarly as described for ORR and DOR per IRRC assessment above, but were assessed per investigator using the 2007 IWG criteria.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Objective Response (DOR) Based on Investigator Assessments in Cohorts A, B, and C
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of first study drug dose up to approximately 28 months
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator-assessed ORR and DOR were defined similarly as described for ORR and DOR per IRRC assessment above, but were assessed per investigator using the 2007 IWG criteria.

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment Discontinuation Rate in Cohort D
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose to end of combination therapy up to 28 months
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects were treated with four doses of nivolumab flat dose 240 mg IV every 2 weeks (monotherapy phase), followed by twelve doses of the combination of AVD (Adriamycin/ doxorubicin 25 mg/m2, vinblastine 6 mg/m2, dacarbazine 375 mg/m2) chemotherapy and nivolumab flat dose 240 mg IV for 6 cycles (combination phase). Each 28-day dosing period constituted a Combocycle: two doses of the combination therapy per cycle, except for Combocycle 6, which was only a 15-day cycle. The combination therapy was administered every 2 weeks for 12 doses (two doses, Dose 1 on Day 1 and Dose 2 on Day 15, of each Combocycle x 6 cycles). The combination phase ended at Dose 2 (Day 15) of Combocycle 6. The primary analysis for Cohort D was conducted when all treated patients for Cohort D had completed follow-up visit 1 and end-of- therapy response assessment. All analyses for Cohort D were performed separately from other cohorts.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Deaths in Cohort D
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose up to 28 months
secondary_outcome.description: Safety was analyzed through the incidence of deaths, adverse events, serious adverse events, adverse events leading to discontinuation, adverse events leading to dose delay, select adverse events and specific laboratory abnormalities (worst grade). Toxicities will be graded using the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.0. Safety of subjects was analyzed per treatment phase (monotherapy phase, combination therapy phase) and overall.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Adverse Events (AEs) in Cohort D
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From last dose up to 120 days
secondary_outcome.description: Safety was analyzed through the incidence of deaths, adverse events, serious adverse events, adverse events leading to discontinuation, adverse events leading to dose delay, select adverse events and specific laboratory abnormalities (worst grade). Toxicities will be graded using the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.0. Safety of subjects was analyzed per treatment phase (monotherapy phase, combination therapy phase) and overall.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) in Cohort D
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From last dose up to 120 days
secondary_outcome.description: Safety was analyzed through the incidence of deaths, adverse events, serious adverse events, adverse events leading to discontinuation, adverse events leading to dose delay, select adverse events and specific laboratory abnormalities (worst grade). Toxicities will be graded using the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.0. Safety of subjects was analyzed per treatment phase (monotherapy phase, combination therapy phase) and overall.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of AEs Leading to Discontinuation in Cohort D
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From last dose up to 120 days
secondary_outcome.description: Safety was analyzed through the incidence of deaths, adverse events, serious adverse events, adverse events leading to discontinuation, adverse events leading to dose delay, select adverse events and specific laboratory abnormalities (worst grade). Toxicities will be graded using the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.0. Safety of subjects was analyzed per treatment phase (monotherapy phase, combination therapy phase) and overall.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of AEs Leading to Dose Delay in Cohort D
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From last dose up to 120 days
secondary_outcome.description: Safety was analyzed through the incidence of deaths, adverse events, serious adverse events, adverse events leading to discontinuation, adverse events leading to dose delay, select adverse events and specific laboratory abnormalities (worst grade). Toxicities will be graded using the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.0. Safety of subjects was analyzed per treatment phase (monotherapy phase, combination therapy phase) and overall.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Select AEs in Cohort D
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From last dose up to 120 days
secondary_outcome.description: Select AEs have been categorized into seven areas: pulmonary toxicity, gastrointestinal toxicity, hepatotoxicity, endocrinopathy, skin toxicity, neurological toxicity and renal toxicity. Select AEs, in particular pneumonitis, are considered clinically meaningful as they require greater vigilance and for early recognition and prompt intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Grade 3-4 Laboratory Abnormalities in Cohort D
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From last dose up to 120 days

arm_group.arm_group_label: Nivolumab (Cohort A, B, C and D)
arm_group.description: Cohort (A, B, C): Nivolumab: Specified dose on specified days Cohort (D): Nivolumab: Specified dose on specified days + Doxorubicin: Specified dose on specified days + Vinblastine: Specified dose on specified days + Dacarbazine: Specified dose on specified days

intervention.arm_group_label: Nivolumab (Cohort A, B, C and D)
Nivolumab (Cohort A, B, C and D)
Nivolumab (Cohort A, B, C and D)
Nivolumab (Cohort A, B, C and D)

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding BMS clinical trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com
Inclusion Criteria:
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status 0 or 1
- Must have received prior high-dose conditioning chemotherapy followed by autologous stem cell transplant (ASCT) as a part of salvage therapy for cHL (cohort A, B & C - enrollment closed)
- Participants may be Brentuximab vedotin- naïve, or may have had prior Brentuximab vedotin treatment (cohort A, B & C - enrollment closed)
- Newly diagnosed and previously untreated classical Hodgkin Lymphoma (cohort D)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known central nervous system lymphoma
- Participants with nodular lymphocyte-predominant Hodgkin Lymphoma
- Prior allogeneic stem cell transplantation (SCT)
- Chest radiation ≤ 24 weeks prior to first dose
- Carmustine ≥ 600 mg/m² received as part of the pre-transplant conditioning regimen

facility.name: Division Of Hematology & Oncology Ctr. For Health Sciences
The Cancer Center At Hackensack University Medical Center
University Hopistal ULM Dept of Internal Medizin

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 243 participants were treated at 34 sites in 10 countries for cohorts A, B, and C. Cohort D enrolled separately. 51 participants were treated in cohort D for a total of 294 participants treated all together.

group.title: Cohort A
group.description: Nivolumab 3mg/kg Q2wk, Brentuximab vedotin Naive

group.title: Cohort B
group.description: Nivolumab 3mg/kg Q2wk, Post Transplant Brentuximab vedotin

group.title: Cohort C
group.description: Nivolumab 3mg/kg Q2wk, Post Transplant with Brentuximab vedotin prior and or after ASCT

group.title: Cohort D
group.description: Nivolumab 240 mg IV Q2wk 8 doses monotherapy followed by twelve doses in combination with AVD

outcome.title: Treatment Discontinuation Rate in Cohort D
outcome.description: Subjects were treated with four doses of nivolumab flat dose 240 mg IV every 2 weeks (monotherapy phase), followed by twelve doses of the combination of AVD (Adriamycin/ doxorubicin 25 mg/m2, vinblastine 6 mg/m2, dacarbazine 375 mg/m2) chemotherapy and nivolumab flat dose 240 mg IV for 6 cycles (combination phase). Each 28-day dosing period constituted a Combocycle: two doses of the combination therapy per cycle, except for Combocycle 6, which was only a 15-day cycle. The combination therapy was administered every 2 weeks for 12 doses (two doses, Dose 1 on Day 1 and Dose 2 on Day 15, of each Combocycle x 6 cycles). The combination phase ended at Dose 2 (Day 15) of Combocycle 6. The primary analysis for Cohort D was conducted when all treated patients for Cohort D had completed follow-up visit 1 and end-of- therapy response assessment. All analyses for Cohort D were performed separately from other cohorts.
outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose to end of combination therapy up to 28 months

group.title: Cohort D
group.description: Nivolumab 240 mg IV Q2wk 8 doses monotherapy followed by twelve doses in combination with AVD

measure.title: Treatment Discontinuation Rate in Cohort D
measure.description: Subjects were treated with four doses of nivolumab flat dose 240 mg IV every 2 weeks (monotherapy phase), followed by twelve doses of the combination of AVD (Adriamycin/ doxorubicin 25 mg/m2, vinblastine 6 mg/m2, dacarbazine 375 mg/m2) chemotherapy and nivolumab flat dose 240 mg IV for 6 cycles (combination phase). Each 28-day dosing period constituted a Combocycle: two doses of the combination therapy per cycle, except for Combocycle 6, which was only a 15-day cycle. The combination therapy was administered every 2 weeks for 12 doses (two doses, Dose 1 on Day 1 and Dose 2 on Day 15, of each Combocycle x 6 cycles). The combination phase ended at Dose 2 (Day 15) of Combocycle 6. The primary analysis for Cohort D was conducted when all treated patients for Cohort D had completed follow-up visit 1 and end-of- therapy response assessment. All analyses for Cohort D were performed separately from other cohorts.

outcome.title: Incidence of Deaths in Cohort D
outcome.description: Safety was analyzed through the incidence of deaths, adverse events, serious adverse events, adverse events leading to discontinuation, adverse events leading to dose delay, select adverse events and specific laboratory abnormalities (worst grade). Toxicities will be graded using the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.0. Safety of subjects was analyzed per treatment phase (monotherapy phase, combination therapy phase) and overall.
outcome.time_frame: From first dose up to 28 months

measure.title: Incidence of AEs Leading to Discontinuation in Cohort D
measure.description: Safety was analyzed through the incidence of deaths, adverse events, serious adverse events, adverse events leading to discontinuation, adverse events leading to dose delay, select adverse events and specific laboratory abnormalities (worst grade). Toxicities will be graded using the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.0. Safety of subjects was analyzed per treatment phase (monotherapy phase, combination therapy phase) and overall.

outcome.title: Incidence of AEs Leading to Dose Delay in Cohort D
outcome.description: Safety was analyzed through the incidence of deaths, adverse events, serious adverse events, adverse events leading to discontinuation, adverse events leading to dose delay, select adverse events and specific laboratory abnormalities (worst grade). Toxicities will be graded using the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.0. Safety of subjects was analyzed per treatment phase (monotherapy phase, combination therapy phase) and overall.
outcome.time_frame: From last dose up to 120 days

group.title: Cohort D
group.description: Nivolumab 240 mg IV Q2wk 8 doses monotherapy followed by twelve doses in combination with AVD

measure.title: Incidence of AEs Leading to Dose Delay in Cohort D
measure.description: Safety was analyzed through the incidence of deaths, adverse events, serious adverse events, adverse events leading to discontinuation, adverse events leading to dose delay, select adverse events and specific laboratory abnormalities (worst grade). Toxicities will be graded using the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.0. Safety of subjects was analyzed per treatment phase (monotherapy phase, combination therapy phase) and overall.

outcome.title: Incidence of Select AEs in Cohort D
outcome.description: Select AEs have been categorized into seven areas: pulmonary toxicity, gastrointestinal toxicity, hepatotoxicity, endocrinopathy, skin toxicity, neurological toxicity and renal toxicity. Select AEs, in particular pneumonitis, are considered clinically meaningful as they require greater vigilance and for early recognition and prompt intervention.
outcome.time_frame: From last dose up to 120 days

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Non-Comparative, Multi-Cohort, Single-Arm, Open-Label, Phase 2 Study of
